question.title: Save Parent/Child Entities without any references to one another
question.body:
I have two entities (A and B) which so far have been separate and unrelated. I now have a situation where there can be a single B associated with an A. I would like to set up Entity A so that when persisted, it will also persist Entity B (if one is defined), however I do not want any references on A to B or on B to A. Once persisted they should be completely independent and unrelated (so if I later load A, the field for B can be null). I need to be able to update and delete A and B independently once saved.

Is there a way to setup the annotations to make this happen? @OneToOne seems to rely on there being some sort of join column or foreign key dependency, and @OneToMany requires that the property be a collection, which isn't correct for our model.

My best approach right now seems to be mark B as @Transient on A and persist it separately, but it'd be nice to get it to all save in one go.

question_comments.body: Best option is use @Transient and manually persist it. You can also use @PrePersist to put manual part there. BTW you can do this part (so if I later load A, the field for B can be null) keeping JPA reference also.
